oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Confederate national and state currency
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Two $100 CSA notes from Richmond, Va. and one $5 State of Ga. note from The City Bank of Augusta, GA. The $100 bills are authorized by the Confederate States of America and promise to pay the bearer "six months after the ratification of a treaty of peace between the CSA and USA." The items were framed together by the donor's father in commemoration of the Civil War Centennial.
